ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good course for prospective PhD students
I recommend this course for passing comps.
You have to take it, so deal with it. Find a good book on game theory b/c you won't learn it in Q3. MWG are okay, Osborne helps for basics.
Good. Gives you a good primer to the Game theory.
Yes, the course is informative and useful.
Lots of work, lots of learning. Take it if you want the understanding, but know what you are getting into.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It certainly helps but I doubt how much.
I felt more confused leaving this class than entering.
Not much, though Johannes's part did expose me to some interesting topics that are somewhat relevant to current research.
This is my field, so it is most relevant.
The principles of game theory are essential to understand for all economists who aim to be at the top of the field. Also extremely useful for other social scientists.
